alert.note: Alert for Carquinez Strait and Delta; Northern San Joaquin Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 2:01PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central San Joaquin and northern Stanislaus Counties through 245 PM PDT... At 201 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tracy to near Ripon. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stockton, Tracy, Manteca, Lathrop, Ripon, Escalon, Del Rio, Waterloo, Country Club, Taft Mosswood, Garden Acres, Kennedy, August, Farmington, French Camp, Linden, Morada and Lincoln Village. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Carquinez Strait and Delta; Northern San Joaquin Valley
